description: {"blocks":[{"key":"75lqf","text":"Epifluorescence microscopy (EFM) has been the gold standard method for environmental viral enumeration for over 25 years. Currently, standard EFM methods using the Anodisc filters are no longer cost-effective (\u003e$15 per slide). We present a cost-effective method for environmental viral enumeration from aquatic samples, microbial mats, and exopolymeric substances (EPSs) within modern microbialites using EFM. Our integrated approach, which includes filtration, differential centrifugation, chloroform treatment, glutaraldehyde fixation, benzonase nuclease treatment, probe sonication (EPS and mat only), SYBR Gold staining, wet mounting, and imaging, provides a robust method for modern microbialites and aquatic samples. Our method provides a robust and cost-effective (~$0.75 per sample) viral enumeration within modern microbialites and aquatic ecosystems.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"73dfu","text":"This method is used to enumerate viruses in water samples collected from the environment. See our protocols for microbialite viral enumeration, EPS viral enumeration, and soil viral enumeration!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: EFM, epifluorescence microscopy, viral enumeration, microbialite, enumeration, phage

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f51tk","text":"Record the starting volume of water, this will be used for calculations later.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9ou0","text":"Filter water through a glass fiber pre filter (Whatman Grade 1 qualitative filter paper).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fp7m","text":"Collect filtrate and filter through a 0.65 μm PVDF filter (Durapore PVDF membrane filter; hydrophilic).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"69ini","text":"Collect filtrate again and filter two times through 0.22 μm PVDF filters (Durapore PVDF membrane filter; hydrophilic).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75io4","text":"If only filtering samples,  . Continue through this section for optional concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8A6912EB2F944FFB87CA5FF1EEB572CA","step_guid":"59DF34E57C1E4378B5E1A5BD2C9C9725","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9v8q","text":"Collect filtrate and add to the top portion of 30 kDa MWCO Centricon-70 plus centrifuge filters (Millipore UFC703008).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4fj2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ep0tu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8rleh","text":"Centrifuge filters come in a range of volumes (0.5 - 70 mL). These filters can be reused for similar samples. If storing used filters for reuse, after removing concentrate add a small amount of ultrafiltrate or sterile/filtered (0.22 um x2), enough to cover the filter surface, and store at 4ºC.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3fikm","text":"Centrifuge at   (if using smaller volume filters adjust speed and time according to manufacturer instructions).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"3500","duration":720,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0n75","text":"After centrifugation, collect the ultrafiltrate from the collection cup below the filter and add more 0.22 μm filtered water to the top. Continue to centrifuge as explained in step 7 until all water has passed through the filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"110c1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f09dm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3nop","text":"Centricon-70 plus filters come with retrieval cups, but some smaller sizes do not. Smaller sized filters can be removed and flipped upside down into a 15 or 50 mL conical tube and centrifuged to collect concentrate. Amicon ultra-15 filters do not fit into conical tubes. To collect concentrate use a pipette to remove concentrate from the filter area, careful not to puncture the filter.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bm24f","text":"After concentrating all the water, attach the retrieval cup to the top of the filter and flip upside down. Centrifuge at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":121,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"3500","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49dpq","text":"Collect the concentrate from the retrieval cup and pipette into a 1.5 mL low protein binding nuclease free microcentrifuge tube. Record the volume of concentrate recovered.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9qkf0","text":"Dilute concentrate ~3:10 with ultrafiltrate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42qtf","text":"Add   of   to the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"epgnd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fhdca","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94u1m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aog6j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"4104F027341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"CHCl3","mol_weight":119.37,"name":"Chloroform","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"","stats":{"total_protocols":24},"url":"","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/1.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.protocols.io","name":"Contributed by users"}}},"2":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ln8h","text":"A lab coat, face and eye protection, and double gloves should be worn whenever working with chloroform, in addition to being performed in a fume hood.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3991n","text":"A small glass pasteur pipette must be used when working with chloroform. The pasteur pipette’s full volume should be 500 μL.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"58n56","text":"Centrifuge the samples at   (standard mini-fuge speed).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d4i3r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"14.000","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9d67k","text":"Use glass pasteur pipette to carefully pipette the sample portion of the supernatant (top part) into a fresh 1.5 mL low protein binding nuclease free microcentrifuge tube, making sure to not get any chloroform.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4db4c","text":"Aliquot   of the diluted concentrate into a fresh 1.5 mL low protein binding nuclease free microcentrifuge tube, proceed to the next section: Water Enumeration - Fixation ( ).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":172,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8dftc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"92","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6E13CACAFF2C445BB906DA00D3C64A82","step_guid":"59DF34E57C1E4378B5E1A5BD2C9C9725","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1l73u","text":"Add 8 μL of EM grade 25% glutaraldehyde to each of the 92 μL samples (final concentration of 2%). Pipette to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5eou","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e4vlq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cteim","text":"Fixation should be done in a fume hood as it requires working with glutaraldehyde Additionally, a lab coat, face and eye protection, and gloves should be worn whenever working with glutaraldehyde.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8t18d","text":"Allow samples to fix in the dark at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":42,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cddgc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3d8tc","text":"OPTIONAL: Flash freeze samples using liquid nitrogen. If liquid nitrogen is not available, putting samples directly in a -80ºC freezer can be done. Samples can be stored in the -80ºC freezer until use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5401j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d52f9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"alu7p","text":"This is an optional stopping point. Freezing is not necessary and may cause a decrease in viral counts. If you do not have time to proceed to dyeing and imaging, freeze your samples until use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1nv30","text":"Thaw fixed samples at room temperature (if applicable). During this time, start heating a heat block to  . {"blocks":[{"key":"aommo","text":"Aliquot   of sample into a new 1.5 mL low protein binding nuclease free microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"19","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

Pipette to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"4198D07D341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Benzonase® Nuclease","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"E1014 SIGMA","stats":{"total_protocols":6},"url":"","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"http://sigmaaldrich.com","name":"Merck MilliporeSigma (Sigma-Aldrich)"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8lh1p","text":"Incubate the samples in a heat block at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":46,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bee2e","text":"Add   SYBR Gold working stock to the sample in the dark and pipette to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7h0vt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"87g5e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7hb6n","text":"The stain is light sensitive so the following steps should be done in the dark. Before preparing working stock, be sure to check if there is already some prepared. Working stocks may be stored in the -20ºC freezer or one working stock at a time may be stored in the 4ºC fridge.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":25}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3aora","text":"Thaw commercial stock of   at room temperature in the dark.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cpra7","text":"Once the commercial stock is thawed, vortex for 10 seconds on medium-high speed, then centrifuge in a microcentrifuge for 5 minutes.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d6lvp","text":"Dilute the commercial stock 1:10 with autoclaved and filtered (0.22 μm PVDF membrane filters) molecular biology grade water in a fresh 5 mL Eppendorf tube.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"574ip","text":"Filter the working stock through a 0.22 μm syringe filter into a fresh 5 mL Eppendorf tube.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fofce","text":"Aliquot 250 μL of the working stock into fresh black or darkened 1.5 mL low protein binding nuclease free microcentrifuge tubes.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8qid2","text":"Store the working stocks at -20ºC.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"djbb1","text":"Working stock that is being used should be stored at 4ºC in the dark. It can work effectively for about a month, but will degrade over time (take note of when working stock is moved to 4ºC).","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1l2ef","text":"Working stock at -20ºC can be stored indefinitely and transferred to 4ºC when ready to use. Avoid freezing and thawing multiple times.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bu49m","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"41042AD6341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"SYBR Gold Nucleic Acid Gel Stain","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":" S-11494 ","stats":{"total_protocols":7},"url":"https://www.lifetechnologies.com/order/catalog/product/S11494","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/1.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.protocols.io","name":"Contributed by users"}},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"reagents"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gg8k","text":"Incubate the sample in a heat block covered in aluminum foil at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":70,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dge7m","text":"While the sample is incubating, prepare a 10% ascorbic acid antifade solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ar27j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ctvmk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cbe5c","text":"Ascorbic acid antifade needs to be prepared fresh each time, so only prepare a small amount\nas needed. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bgnn2","text":"Add 1 mL 1X PBS to a fresh 1.5 mL low protein binding nuclease free microcentrifuge tube.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4p4um","text":"Add 0.1 g ascorbic acid to the tube.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fqlbs","text":"Mix thoroughly by vortexing until the ascorbic acid has dissolved completely.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"pv58","text":"Filter the mixture twice through 0.22 μm syringe filters.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"496f6","text":"Remove the sample from the heat block and add   of ascorbic acid antifade solution. Pipette to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":46,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"41vv8","text":"Pipette   onto a clean, labeled, poly-L-lysine treated slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a0pfh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a463n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"936rd","text":"Thoroughly clean slides with 70% ethanol and allow slides to dry completely. ","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6nsem","text":"Prepare a 10% polylysine solution by diluting Poly-L-Lysine 0.01% w/v 1:10 in autoclaved Nanopure water (18.2 MΩ) (using plastic pipette tips and a plastic container).","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7lhal","text":"Soak slides in the polylysine solution in a plastic container for 5 minutes (increasing time will not improve performance). Ensure there are no air bubbles on the slides.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c2uhv","text":"Dry slides in a drying oven at 60ºC for one hour or overnight at room temperature. ","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2qfrc","text":"Once dried, slides can be stored in a plastic slide box at room temperature until use.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ajpp3","text":"Gently cover with a cover slide, avoiding creating air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dipcg","text":"Image on a fluorescence microscope under FITC blue excitation light (495 nm) with a 100x oil stage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"4d7n6","text":"Fixation with glutaraldehyde and chloroform treatment needs to be performed in a fume hood with a face shield and proper PPE. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"flat9","text":"Needles used to remove glutaraldehyde from serum vials need to be disposed of in a sharps container within the fume hood. Never replace the cap on a needle. Once the needle has been used, immediately deposit it into the sharps container.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
